  name={<><a href="#addead5fcbbc3d5611ee3b43c184d99b0">getApproxInstrDistance</a> (SlotIndex other) const</>}>
Return the scaled distance from this index to the given one, where all slots on the same instruction have zero distance, assuming that the slot indices are packed as densely as possible. <a href="#addead5fcbbc3d5611ee3b43c184d99b0">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

### getApproxInstrDistance() {#addead5fcbbc3d5611ee3b43c184d99b0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>int llvm::SlotIndex::getApproxInstrDistance (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> other) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return the scaled distance from this index to the given one, where all slots on the same instruction have zero distance, assuming that the slot indices are packed as densely as possible.

There are normally gaps between instructions, so this assumption often doesn&#39;t hold. This results in this function often returning a value greater than the actual instruction distance.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/slotindexes-h/#l00203">203</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/slotindexes-h">SlotIndexes.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getBaseIndex() {#aa94e57689dd16c1c4de909511f1b2ea8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="SlotIndex llvm::SlotIndex::getBaseIndex () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns the base index for associated with this index.

The base index is the one associated with the Slot&#95;Block slot for the instruction pointed to by this index.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/slotindexes-h/#l00224">224</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/slotindexes-h">SlotIndexes.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Returns the boundary index for associated with this index.

The boundary index is the one associated with the Slot&#95;Block slot for the instruction pointed to by this index.

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="SlotIndex llvm::SlotIndex::getNextIndex () const"

Returns the next index.

This is the index corresponding to the this index&#39;s slot, but for the next instruction.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/slotindexes-h/#l00262">262</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/slotindexes-h">SlotIndexes.h</a>.

### getNextSlot() {#ac3782d262b2a58da44d43c6d995aef9d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="SlotIndex llvm::SlotIndex::getNextSlot () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns the next slot in the index list.

This could be either the next slot for the instruction pointed to by this index or, if this index is a STORE, the first slot for the next instruction. WARNING: This method is considerably more expensive than the methods that return specific slots (getUseIndex(), etc). If you can - please use one of those methods.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/slotindexes-h/#l00252">252</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/slotindexes-h">SlotIndexes.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="SlotIndex llvm::SlotIndex::getPrevIndex () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns the previous index.

This is the index corresponding to this index&#39;s slot, but for the previous instruction.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/slotindexes-h/#l00282">282</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/slotindexes-h">SlotIndexes.h</a>.

### getPrevSlot() {#ac832da130f4d71a4533a69d98315fb19}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="SlotIndex llvm::SlotIndex::getPrevSlot () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns the previous slot in the index list.

This could be either the previous slot for the instruction pointed to by this index or, if this index is a Slot&#95;Block, the last slot for the previous instruction. WARNING: This method is considerably more expensive than the methods that return specific slots (getUseIndex(), etc). If you can - please use one of those methods.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/slotindexes-h/#l00272">272</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/slotindexes-h">SlotIndexes.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isValid() {#a5bcdd85778add4287db384472cde8acd}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::SlotIndex::isValid () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns true if this is a valid index.

Invalid indices do not point into an index table, and cannot be compared.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/slotindexes-h/#l00130">130</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/slotindexes-h">SlotIndexes.h</a>.

## Public Static Functions

### isEarlierEqualInstr() {#a9a3b4f5099b0b155a28643224061e584}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool llvm::SlotIndex::isEarlierEqualInstr (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> A, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> B)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Return true if A refers to the same instruction as B or an earlier one.

This is equivalent to !isEarlierInstr(B, A).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/slotindexes-h/#l00188">188</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/slotindexes-h">SlotIndexes.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isEarlierInstr() {#a19695ead28a0fbdcea66c6253aebc44f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool llvm::SlotIndex::isEarlierInstr (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> A, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindex">SlotIndex</a> B)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
isEarlierInstr - Return true if A refers to an instruction earlier than B.

This is equivalent to A &lt; B &amp;&amp; !isSameInstr(A, B).
